name: Slack Slash Commands as a Service
tagline: Making Slack better since some time early 2015.
body:
### What's currently available?
At the moment SSCaaS has the following slash commands available:

* [Dictionary lookup](#dictionary-lookup)
* [Developer Excuses](#developer-excuses)
* [Reddit linker](#reddit-linker)
* [Site availability checker](#site-availability-checker)
* [Urban Dictionary lookup](#urban-dictionary-lookup)

### Great! How do I get started?

The first thing you'll need to do is [create an Incoming Webhook](https://slack.com/services/new/incoming-webhook) which will allow SSCaaS to post messages into your Slack instance in response to slash commands.

You should be given a Webhook URL, keep a hold of this as you'll need it later.

The next step is to [add a Slash Command](https://slack.com/services/new/slash-commands).  The URL and setup will vary based on which command you would like to use, see below for the full instructions for each command.

### I think you should have X in SSCaaS.
I probably agree! Feel free to open an issue on the project or, even better, a Pull Request!

### I don't trust you, I want to self-host this.
Go for it!  You should be able to simply `go get` the package and install it without any issues.
